info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, northwestern Pickens and northern Oconee Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Walhalla, or near Oconee State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Six Mile, Salem, Lake Keowee, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Devils Fork State Park, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Oconee State Park, Mountain Rest and Bad Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for western North Carolina. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
